intro: Zauschneria californica var. arizonica, commonly known as Arizona gold poppy, is a striking annual plant native to the southwestern United States. It features showy, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet, with slender, branching stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it well-suited for arid and semi-arid environments. Its botanical characteristics make it a popular choice for xeriscaping and native plant gardens.
